title: Tariffs and Tech: How Trump's Proposed Policies Could Impact Gamers
description: In this episode, we dive into the potential effects of Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs on gamers and tech enthusiasts. We break down the costs, the industry’s response, and what it could mean for the future of electronics in the U.S.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Hello and welcome to another episode of 'Life is Artificial,' where we explore the cutting edge of technology, innovation, and what the future could look like.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Today, we’re diving into a topic that’s been making waves among gamers, tech enthusiasts, and anyone looking to buy a laptop or smartphone in the near future. Our source for today’s topic is an article from Gizmodo titled, 'Trump’s Proposed Tariffs Will Hit Gamers Hard.'

script.speaker: Host
script.text: With Donald Trump back in the news and possibly returning to office, he’s once again bringing up plans to impose high tariffs on goods from countries like China, a move that could make electronics significantly more expensive in the United States. Gizmodo reports that Trump has proposed tariffs as high as 60% on Chinese imports. Let’s break down what that could mean for you and your tech.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: First, let’s look at why we’ve enjoyed relatively low prices on electronics here in the U.S. For years, affordable tech has been made possible due to a robust trade relationship with China, allowing companies to manufacture electronics like laptops, gaming consoles, and smartphones at lower costs. But Trump’s tariff plan is aimed at shifting this model—he wants to bring manufacturing jobs back to the U.S. by discouraging companies from importing goods through hefty taxes or tariffs.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: According to Gizmodo, Trump’s plan includes a 60% tariff on Chinese imports and a general 10-20% tariff on all imports. Now, the problem here is that tariffs don’t actually mean foreign countries pay a fee to bring goods in. Instead, U.S. companies that import these goods from China have to pay the tariff, and they often pass those costs on to us—the consumers. So, if this goes into effect, everything from laptops to gaming consoles could see a serious price jump.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Just to give you an idea of what that would look like, Gizmodo points to a study from the Consumer Technology Association. According to the study, a 60% tariff could mean price spikes across a wide range of products. Laptops, for example, could cost almost 50% more. Smartphones could jump up by around 26%. And if you’re a gamer waiting for the next console, brace yourself: the PS5 Pro, which was expected to be around $500, could cost nearly $1,000. Even a GPU—the kind used for both gaming and AI processing—could go from $900 to $1,300. It’s a huge leap.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: What’s the reason behind these tariffs, and why does Trump believe it will help? Trump’s campaign is pushing the idea that the U.S. has a trade imbalance with China, meaning that we import far more than we export. He wants to see more manufacturing done domestically to reduce reliance on Chinese products. But, here’s the reality: even with these tariffs, it’s still a lot more expensive to manufacture in the U.S. So, the study suggests that companies would likely shift production to other countries—not necessarily the U.S.—in order to keep costs down. In the short term, we would see higher prices on electronics, and in the long term, we’d see manufacturing move, but not necessarily back to the U.S.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: The Consumer Technology Association calls tariffs ‘regressive taxes.’ What this means is that they impact lower-income households the hardest. So, if prices jump by 40-50% on these essential tech products, the financial strain will be felt most by those who already struggle with tight budgets. Ed Brzytwa, CTA’s Vice President of International Trade, emphasizes that tariffs are a burden on American consumers, not foreign governments.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: This is a topic that’s sparked debate and concern among tech industry leaders and consumers alike. During Trump’s first term, the tech industry lobbied hard to avoid similar tariffs, and they succeeded in getting some exemptions for electronics. But it’s uncertain if they’ll be able to pull it off again if Trump returns to office and remains committed to these policies.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: So, if you’re someone who’s been eyeing a new PC build, upgrading your gaming setup, or getting the latest smartphone, you might want to act sooner rather than later. The new administration would take office in January 2025, and if these tariffs go into effect, prices could rise shortly after that.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: That wraps up our analysis of how these proposed tariffs might affect the tech world and gamers specifically. If you want to learn more, check out the full article on Gizmodo, titled 'Trump’s Proposed Tariffs Will Hit Gamers Hard.' And let’s keep this conversation going—what do you think about these potential changes? Are you planning any tech upgrades soon to beat the price hikes? Let us know your thoughts!

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Thank you for tuning in to 'Life is Artificial.' Until next time, stay informed, stay connected, and keep exploring what’s next in our rapidly changing world. See you in the next episode!
